intro: Heteroplexis sericophylla, commonly known as the silky leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, silvery-green leaves and small, daisy-like white flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. Heteroplexis sericophylla is well adapted to arid conditions and can thrive with minimal water.
